sorular.soru: Is a coach driver allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: This lane may only be used by bus drivers. A coach is also a bus.

sorular.soru: Are you driving well here?
cevaplar: Yes. You are driving well here.
No. You must drive further to the right.
No. You must drive further to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are driving well here.

feedback.metin: Yellow temporary lineation is above the white lineation. The carriageways here are temporarily shifted to the left, so you are driving in the middle of the right lane. Your position is good.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn left here?

feedback.metin: The sign indicates that this road may be entered from two sides. You are therefore allowed to turn left here. This sign is often used in ambiguous situations to indicate that the road may be entered from both directions, so you must take oncoming vehicles into account.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?

feedback.metin: The stop sign is aimed at traffic approaching the controller from the right. You are approaching from the left and may therefore drive on.

sorular.soru: Can you drive when the windscreen washer fluid has run out?

feedback.metin: You may not drive with insufficient windscreen washer fluid. A dirty windscreen cannot be cleaned in the event of insufficient windscreen washer fluid, which presents a risk of insufficient visibility.

sorular.soru: In which situation do you have to let the pedestrian go first?

feedback.metin: The stop sign means that the passenger car has to give priority to all drivers on the intersecting road. This does not say anything about pedestrians walking on the same road. The rule 'through traffic on the same road goes before traffic turning off' still stands. Because the pedestrian walks straight ahead and the passenger car turns off, the pedestrian can go first in both situations.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here to pick up a hitchhiker?

feedback.metin: You may only stop on the hard shoulder in case of an emergency situation. Picking up a hitchhiker is not an emergency situation.

sorular.soru: What do you do if merging traffic does not have enough space to get in lane?
cevaplar: If possible, move to the left lane.
Nothing. They have to give way to you.
sorular.dogruCevap: If possible, move to the left lane.

feedback.metin: If both the right lane and acceleration lane are busy, the best thing you can do to make space is move over to the left lane. However, only do this if you do not cause any hindrance to the drivers on the left lane! If the left lane is busy as well, you can try and make space by either releasing the accelerator or by accelerating. Never brake just like that.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to make a phone call?

feedback.metin: Crossing a solid edge line is allowed, so you can park next to the road unless otherwise prohibited by signage. Parking on the hard shoulder of a motorway or the refuge of an autoweg is forbidden, as these may only be used in emergencies. However, this is not a motorway or an autoweg. The presence of an information sign is an important indication that you are allowed to park here. Waiting and looking at a map both qualify as parking, as does using a telephone.

sorular.soru: To which riders do these signs apply?
cevaplar: To moped and speed pedelec riders.
To moped riders, speed pedelec riders and snorfietsers.
sorular.dogruCevap: To moped and speed pedelec riders.

feedback.metin: These signs require moped riders to pass the sign on the side indicated by the arrow. Speed pedelec riders must adhere to the same rules as moped riders, so these signs also apply to them. These signs indicate that these riders must leave the carriageway and enter the cycle/moped path, or the other way around. Snorfietsers should follow the rules and signs of the cyclists, not the mopeds. So these signs do not apply to them.

sorular.soru: Does a passenger car need to be equipped with front fog lights?

feedback.metin: Front fog lights are not mandatory on passenger cars. You may have a maximum of two front fog lights on a passenger vehicle.

sorular.soru: Can certain medications affect driving skills?

feedback.metin: Some medications may affect your ability to drive, such as certain heart or blood pressure medications, sleeping aids, and sedatives. The medications are labelled with a yellow sticker with warning text. Some cough syrups and other over-the-counter medications can also impair your ability to drive. Always consult your pharmacist before use.

sorular.soru: What traffic behaviour is expected of you here?
cevaplar: You must brake and swerve into the verge.
You must drive on the left lane.
You must maintain the same speed.
sorular.dogruCevap: You must maintain the same speed.

feedback.metin: To best assist the police car behind you, drive predictably and follow the rules of traffic. Do not brake or swerve.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to drive straight ahead?

feedback.metin: The arrow on the sign indicates the direction that vehicles with certain hazardous substances must follow. You do not have to follow the indicated direction if you are not transporting any dangerous goods.

sorular.soru: Which part is called the blind spot?

feedback.metin: Part A is the area to the left in front of the vehicle. The driver has sufficient visibility of this area, with only a small section behind the angle of the windscreen and side window not directly visible. The driver also has a sufficient view of part C via the left mirror. In part B, the driver does not have a direct view. This is called the blind spot. To get a clear view of this, the driver has to turn his head and look over his shoulder.

sorular.soru: What should you do here?
cevaplar: Keep driving in the same position.
Move slightly more to the right.
Move slightly more to the left.
sorular.dogruCevap: Move slightly more to the left.

feedback.metin: The motorcyclist behind you probably wants to pass in between the traffic jam. This is allowed. To make space for this, you must move slightly more to the left of your lane.

sorular.soru: Should you expect crossing mopeds here?

feedback.metin: The J-24 sign warns of crossing bicycles, mopeds, snorfietsen, and speed pedelecs. The bottom sign indicates that these road users may cross from the left or the right. The sign says nothing about right of way. Always look for signs indicating right of way. If they are absent, always give right of way to drivers approaching from the right.

sorular.soru: What speed limit should you expect on this road?

feedback.metin: Roads with a double centre line without a green line in between, are designed as 80km roads. The centre lines can be both solid lines as well as broken lines. The centre line can also be a single line. Usually, the edge lines are broken lines.

sorular.soru: Is this the safest place to stand when you are having car trouble?

feedback.metin: You can stand on the verge here. The further you are from the carriageway, the safer it is.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to keep driving like this if you want to continue straight on?

feedback.metin: You are driving on the right-hand lane here for straight ahead. Your position is good for when you want to continue straight ahead. The two lanes on the right side are turning off. You are allowed to keep driving like this.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive 100 km/h here?

feedback.metin: You are driving on an autoweg where the speed limit is 100 km/h. The same speed limit applies for both a passenger car with a bicycle carrier as a passenger car without a bicycle carrier. A bicycle carrier is therefore not the same as a trailer. The speed limit for a passenger car with trailer on autowegen and motorways is 90 km/h.

sorular.soru: Which part of the road is called a lane?

feedback.metin: A lane is a section of carriageway marked with solid or broken lines. A lane must be wide enough to fit a car. This means cycle lanes are not separate lanes.

sorular.soru: Can you drive with a damaged driving licence?

feedback.metin: You may only drive a car if you have a valid, original, and undamaged driving licence in your possession.

sorular.soru: Should you expect oncoming traffic on a motorway?

feedback.metin: Motorways have separate carriageways and uneven intersections. You should not expect oncoming traffic on motorways.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake with a trailer?

feedback.metin: Here, overtaking is prohibited for lorries. This sign does not apply to passenger cars with trailers. You are allowed to overtake. Keep in mind that you are not as fast with accelerating and that you have to pass the vehicle completely before moving to the right again. You need a lot more space to overtake than a car without a trailer. So, it is not always wise to overtake when pulling a trailer behind your car.

sorular.soru: What influence does a short following distance have on energy consumption?
cevaplar: This has no effect on energy consumption.

feedback.metin: Sufficient following distance between you and the car in front of you is not only safer, it also means you can maintain your speed more consistently. Following closely behind another vehicle causes you to brake and accelerate more often, increasing energy consumption significantly.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: You may not stop next to a solid yellow line, which means parking is also forbidden. If the yellow line was broken, you would be allowed to stop, but parking would still be forbidden.

sorular.soru: Should you give this pedestrian the opportunity to cross?
cevaplar: No, this is not mandatory but it is considered preferable.

feedback.metin: The person on crutches falls under the category 'person with decreased mobility'. You are therefore required to give this person right of way. The fact that there is a tram stop with a platform is not important here.

sorular.soru: Are you entering a 30km zone here?

feedback.metin: You are driving past a recommended speed sign. This is not a 30km zone. It is, however, advisable to drive 30 km/h after this sign, this is not mandatory.

sorular.soru: What are the risks of having a separate navigation system attached to the windscreen?
cevaplar: You may damage the windscreen when attaching the system.
You may create an extra blind spot.
You may be more distracted than with a built-in system.
sorular.dogruCevap: You may create an extra blind spot.

feedback.metin: Always be careful when attaching a navigation system to the front windscreen. Try to place these at the bottom or in the corner where possible. Although a small device, cyclists and sometimes even cars can be made invisible by the presence of a navigation system on the windscreen. These systems create an extra blind spot that you must take care to check. There is no danger of damaging the windscreen, as the devices are made for this purpose. Any risk of distraction is no greater than that posed by a built-in navigation system.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this light comes on?
cevaplar: Check tyre pressure as soon as possible.
Stop immediately. You have a flat tyre.
Drive on and call the garage at home.
sorular.dogruCevap: Check tyre pressure as soon as possible.

feedback.metin: This light indicates that at least one tyre has lower pressure than the others. This may mean the tyre is punctured. Make a stop at the next available opportunity to check tyre pressure, such as a petrol station. Do not wait, as low tyre pressure increases the risk of burst tyres and poor grip. Re-inflate the tyres with low pressure and check for any damage, nails, or screws.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a handwritten number plate on the trailer?
cevaplar: Yes. If the number plate is clearly legible.
Only with trailers with a maximum authorised mass up to 750 kg.

feedback.metin: Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of up to 750 kg, must have an original white number plate displaying the same registration number as the vehicle’s plate. Trailers with a maximum authorised mass of more than 750 kg, have their own yellow number plate which does not match the towing vehicle’s plate. Under no circumstances may any driver use a handwritten number plate.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to read your messages while driving?

feedback.metin: Holding a mobile phone while driving is prohibited. This unnecessarily endangers other road users. This applies to anything one would hold a phone for, such as changing music, checking traffic updates, adjusting navigation, making or receiving calls, and sending or receiving text messages.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Slow down and stay behind the cyclist until past the intersection.
Sound the horn so that the cyclist cycles further to the right.
Drive on and overtake the cyclist liberally.
sorular.dogruCevap: Slow down and stay behind the cyclist until past the intersection.

feedback.metin: Overtaking at an intersection is only prohibited when doing so results in a dangerous situation. Overtaking at intersections where the flow of traffic is unclear is therefore prohibited. This is a reasonably well-organised intersection, and you do not have to give right of way to anyone because you are driving on a priority road. However, you must take into account the possibility of cyclists turning off without checking over their shoulder. In this situation, it is therefore wise to stay behind the cyclist until you have passed the intersection.

sorular.soru: From which height may children begin using three-point seat belts only?

feedback.metin: Children under 1.35 metres and under 18 years of age may only be transported using a child restraint system. For children 1.35 metres and taller, the three-point seat belt is sufficient.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you are stopped in the middle of an intersection after an accident that has resulted in minor bumper damage?
cevaplar: Take care of the damage, then move the car.
Call the police and do not move the car until they arrive.
First park the car on the side, then take care of the damage.
sorular.dogruCevap: First park the car on the side, then take care of the damage.

feedback.metin: If you have been involved in an accident resulting in minor damage where the car or cars is/are still drivable, always move the vehicle(s) safely out of the road as soon as possible before dealing with any damage. You are only required to call the police in case of more severe damage, or if the other party does not want to provide details such as their identity or insurance information.

sorular.soru: Is a tram a motor carriage?

feedback.metin: Motor carriages include all vehicles propelled by a motor, which do not use a track (such as a train, metro, or tram). Bicycles with pedal assistance do not qualify as motor carriages, but a speed pedelec does. A trolley bus is also a motor carriage.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake this lorry?

feedback.metin: Despite there being solid line, you are allowed to overtake this lorry. You may ignore the solid line between the rush hour lane and the carriageway when the rush hour lane is opened. Thus, you are allowed to cross this.

sorular.soru: Are tax officials allowed to look into your vehicle registration certificate?

feedback.metin: Tax authorities, police officers, Royal Netherlands Military Constabulary, the public prosecutor, and officials appointed by a Minister are all authorised to ask for your vehicle registration certificate. Further investigation and subsequent consequences may apply in cases such as failure to pay passenger car taxes or if your vehicle no longer meets technical standards (e.g. after an accident).

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit here?

feedback.metin: Drivers are not allowed to drive faster than 15 km/h within an erf. Drivers must take into account pedestrians and children playing.

sorular.soru: What is the thinking time under favourable conditions?

feedback.metin: The average driver has a thinking time of approximately 1 second in favourable conditions.
